metadata.title: CVE-2022-3598 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
LibTIFF 4.4.0 has an out-of-bounds write inextractContigSamplesShifted24bits in tools/tiffcrop.c:3604, allowingattackers to cause a denial-of-service via a crafted tiff file. For usersthat compile libtiff from sources, the fix is available with commitcfbb883b.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3598` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm6
libtiff-tools - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm6
libtiff5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm6
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: tiff package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.6-1ubuntu0.8+esm6').
